FuncDef:
The mac-in-mac command configures a load balancing mode for MAC-in-MAC packets in a load balancing profile.
The undo mac-in-mac command restores the default load balancing mode of MAC-in-MAC packets in a load balancing profile. The mac-in-mac command configures a load balancing mode for MAC-in-MAC packets in a load balancing profile. The undo mac-in-mac command restores the default load balancing mode of MAC-in-MAC packets in a load balancing profile. By default, MAC-in-MAC packets are load balanced based on outer-header. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies load balancing based on the outer header.
-

Specifies load balancing based on the inner header.
-
